Message.Title: 1000 point drop in Dow coming
Message.Msg: The standoff in DC will result in the Dow falling over 1000 points. The 3 major ratings companies will downgrade US debt, our interest obligations on 14 trillion will increase fourfold, the Chinese government that holds a majority of US treasuries are decidedly concerned that a default will roil the world markets as never seen before. Bad times are coming. It would be prudent to go all cash.

Topic.Title: Market is running junk like TSLA and facebook

Message.Msg: Techstrategy, 1) You said, "Where would it be today absent the net $1.5B increase from Q4 debt offering?". Obviously you did not look at 10K/10Q to get the answer you seek. As of June 30, 2013 Cash and marketable securities balance was $7,463M Debts balance was $3,042M Why are you worry about Amazon debts--it is for investments. Amazon can payoff all debts and still have plenty of cash left ($4.4B left). 2) "Where are those operating cash flows coming from?" Certainly not from printing money. This is their earned incomes from operating activities in cash basis. Yes timing may be off by a quarter, but if you look at past 5 years (2008 through 2012), cash inflows were $1.7B, $3.3B, $3.5B, $3.9B and $4.2B. What is not to like about it? P&L did not reflect that because on non-cash items. We all can speculate future cash flows differently. From what I am seeing and hearing from different sources, Amazon is position itself to take the business to the next level. How it fare out, only time will tell. Expansion of Lab126... Rumor of new products (set-top box, android console and regular/3D/Kindle smartphones)... Filed trademark application for name "Firetube", possibly for a set-top box... Cheers!

Topic.Title: Market is running junk like TSLA and facebook

Message.Msg: Techstrategy, First of all, I want to thank you. You seem to be the only one on this board I can have a productive discussion with. 1) "...event of a sudden shock to sales would be a tail risk..." I complete agree with you. As of June 30, 2013, current ratio of 1.1 indicated Amazon has ability to payback it's current obligations. Acid-test ratio of 0.7 indicated Amazon cannot pay it's current obligations. Amazon is somewhat dependent on inventory. It is not unusual and is understandable, since Amazon is a retail business. Yes, it could be a problem for Amazon if there is sudden shock to sales. It could happen any time soon because of government shutdown. If that "sales shock" happened, it is because of the market (which is uncontrollable and all business is impacted by it), and not of Amazon business model (which is controllable). The shutdown will be short-lived, otherwise both parties has to answer to the American people, as well as international partners. 2) I understand that current cash inflows is not up to your expectation, but it is not at a level that warrant for anybody to say that Amazon is doom to fail. Amazon can improve it significant by increasing products margin--that is pure gravy for Amazon. 1% increment to product margin will add about $500M to operating income. Anyway, good luck with your endeavors. Cheers! :o)

Topic.Title: Market is running junk like TSLA and facebook

Message.Msg: Amazon's cash is limited compared to payables. It has a negative cash conversion cycle, where it cillect before paying, but if sales actually drop, cash outflows can/will exceed inflows (redemption of gift cards, unearned revenue that does not generate cash will increase as a share of total). In a shock, the value of the inventory drops significantly. It is not liquid, would either be liquidated or Amazon needs another offering. I suspect the latter is on the way shortly, with pumps from "Chinese firewalled" scamalysts...

Topic.Title: Market is running junk like TSLA and facebook

Message.Msg: Techstrategy, Uh...you are repeating what I was saying, but in different wordings. I agree with you. Amazon is dependent on inventory to meet it current obligations as it clearly shown in the acid-test ratio of 0.7. It also understandable too, because Amazon is a retail business with hugh inventory. For past 5 years or more, did Amazon have such issues described in your post, especially all of the market fluctuations and storms happened during that period? No. I am not saying that it will never happen. The risk you were describing is an inherent risk of that any retail business, especially with hugh inventory. I am sure that risk is known to Amazon management. If payable was a problem or a potential problem, why would Amazon repurchased common stock ($960M in 2012, $277 in 2011). Amazon can improve cash balance by increasing product margin (current margin is about 12%, which is low and unhealthy). 1% increment to product margin will increase operating income by $0.5B. Let's us speculate on the outlooks. To me, it is very interesting and it could be turning events in a year or so for Amazon to be at higher level in terms of market capital. We all know that Amazon is expanding its R&D (Lab126), hence many new products will be introduced. Amazon is aiming to capture other market shares (but with what?). We are not just talking about products revenue, but also services revenue (an unexpected one). I am waiting to see how it unfold in a year or so. Clues are out there. Cheers!

Topic.Title: Sybby just shorted a TRUCK LOAD of this trash at 285

Message.Msg: Sybil: "Sybby just shorted a TRUCK LOAD of this trash at 285 Giddy the fvck up! This pig iz going in the TANK - FINALLY!" Yeah, if the price moves against Sybil, she says she didn't short AMZN. If AMZN's price drops right after she covers, she says she didn't cover. What a convenient way to "predict," huh?

Message.Title: Newz print readz: "YELLEN SAID TO BE OBAMA’S NOMINEE TO BE CHIEF OF FED "
Message.Msg: Let the bit coin flow! This chick makes bernanke look like a hawk.... Money will be manufactured to such an extraordinary measure with the continuation of 30 yr t bills (which now look like 20 year t billz after 5 trillion of talf, tarp, qe 1, twist, qe 2, qe infinity at 85 bil/ mo, and 0% interest rates 'for an extended period of time' ) buying 2 and 10 year treasureyz. Yellen will print so much paper that the 30 year buying up the 2ns 10's will have to be refi'd every 5 yearz... This newz will generate a relief rally like no other, thats what its intended to do....... Ob's last ditch to save a failed policy that only managed to transfer more wealth to fewer than any time in history. We are going back up kidz - 1750 on the s&p -- you'll wanna cover over the next week or 3 and reopen in december..... That will be the exhaustive high.... The 2's will invert over the 10's yeild on steady inflation into 2014... The 10's will invert over the 20's and possibly 30's..... Then china will step in and say "6% on the 30's, 12 on the 10's or pound sand because we aint buying your debt for a point and 1/2 no more". Then its lights out , biatchez, come march 2014 after a steady decline from december.... Sybby's call...... You read it here 1st. Get prepared for some dicey action dieock wadz.
